intro: Justicia sessilis, commonly known as the sessile justicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and a reddish or purple hue on the underside. Its showy, tubular flowers are usually pink or red, arranged in spikes at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
